page.title: 04BONAR'S BRIDGES
page.content: {The first bridge}was started in{1811 and finished in{1812.}The architect was{Thomas Telford.} It was built out of stone and steel. Two arches were built and then a steel arch that went to the other side of the Kyle.{The {next bridge}had three metal arches. This bridge was low and had turrets reaching from the bottom of the water to the top of the arches. This was destroyed by a flood in 1892 and rebuilt in 1893.{The present bridge has a steel arched structure and was opened to traffic on the 14th December 1973. At first the locals did not like this bridge.They thought it was tall and ugly but now they have accepted it. A monument stands at the northern end of the bridge and gives information on all the bridges.
